Reviews.Title: “Remote location with no luxuries”
Reviews.Author: nnygaard
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this location for 4 nights. What I wish I knew before our trip was that there is absolutely NOTHING by this hotel (except other hotels. Not even a gas station mini-mart). Unfortunately for us I did not realize the extent it would take to get to civilization. If you are looking for a clean over night stay by the airport and don't mind the rough around the edges decor then this is the place for you. But however, if your plan was like ours and you would like to sightsee in Philadelphia....look elsewhere NOW!!! The hotel does offer a shuttle to the airport/ train stop, but you will likely wait for the shuttle for as long as 25 mins. Then you will take the train, and then the subway. All in all it is about a 1 hour trek each way (if you hit everything right). In hindsight we should have paid an additional $20 a night for a hotel in Center City. Each day we figured the cost of travel to be about $11 per person. Another thing that I wish I had paid attention too...if you want any extras...you are going to pay for it. Food at their restaurant "Relish" is ok, but it is pricey. You are going to pay for internet, color copies, laundry service and parking. After our 4 night stay it was obvious to us that this location is doing everything they can to cut costs. Even if it means holding back on the toilet paper!! All in all...the room was comfortable and clean, but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and not much else”
Reviews.Author: Jjgolfer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is tired and dated. Long line at checkin, and kiosk was broken. Furniture in room worn and in poor condition. Batteries in remote dead. And no wireless internet in sleeping rooms. Deal killer.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep good outside the city”
Reviews.Author: jdny33
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that it's not in the middle of the city, this hotel has a relaxing atmosphere. Affordable accommodations and comfy beds. My biggest gripe is the lack of parking spots

Reviews.Title: “A good choice when flying”
Reviews.Author: BEACHMAN103
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Punta Cana trip. We have stayed at the Four Points next door and at the Wyndham Garden on past trips and would rate this hotel much higher. The rooms were clean, well maintained and appeared to be remodeled in the past year or two. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. The suite layout is ideal for having cocktails with another couple.The restaurant, "Relish" serves excellent hamburgers (we also went back when picking up our cars). Tony proved to be an excellent waiter both times. We had no problem with the shuttle either going to or coming from the airport. We will return here for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Airport Connection and family traveling together”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Suites, Four Points by Sheraton and aloft PHL are all located in the same plaza, which means run by the same shuttle bus as well. The service is average at best but what I need from a long flight is just decent sleep with comfortable bed, clean room with nice shower. Which they had all of the above. I like how the rooms are so big since they are suite like room, which means you get a real living room which can be served as bedroom #2. and they have a solid door which can provide privacy between two room. Other than that, everything is very standard Sheraton .

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ellsworth T
Reviews.Content: Service is Bad, bad, bad. Waited 20 minutes to be asked for a drink. The young lady who finally did serve me did a great job. Same thing next day, couldn't get a coffee at the starbuck stand. Bed was bad, Shower head stuck through the wall like an after thought. The bed was very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are paper thin...”
Reviews.Author: Sawright
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on hotwire and at first was very very pleasantly suprised. We got suite with a king bedroom with a seperate living room area. When you walk in the lobby is grand and huge, there was a line upon check in. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were clean and well put together. There were two sinks, it was great for getting ready in the morning. Now at night time, I quickly fell asleep and around 2am I heard from somewhere around our room the neighbors baby was SCREAMING and crying and it felt like they were right in the hotel room with us. It was terrible, I went down to the service desk and was told that they would talk to the neighbor about the noise.. of course nothing ever happened. I was real upset I paid $120 for a restless sleep and heard every single noise. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Simons Island, Georgia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herdlinger
Reviews.Content: It is always a flip of a coin for me when I need a hotel close to the Philly Airport between Sheraton Suites and Aloft. This time Sheraton Suites won the toss and they proved to be a great choice. Early check-in was not a problem. The room was spacious and clean. They now have a functioning restaurant. The shuttle service is timely.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: kharamela
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work, and I stay in numerous hotels all over the country. This one, although affordable and in a convenient location, had numerous issues. First: the internet. Could not connect in the room and had to sit in the lobby or at their business center (5 computers and a printer), which when you need to work, is not so convenient. Secondly, the hotel needs desperately to be updated. The carpet is old. The wallpaper is old. The counter top in my bathroom was peeling. There were chipped tiles in the shower and there was some mildew. The room was large, and the bed was comfortable, but I don't know if that makes up for the rest. Perhaps I did not order the right thing, but I really was not happy with the food at their restaurant. I have to say that the service was good, both at the front desk and at the restaurant. The shuttle to and from the airport was prompt. All in all, not the worst hotel in the world, but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; old building.”
Reviews.Author: CloneJessie
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice, and gave us a night of free parking, but we probably won't stay here again... the building is very old with all the rooms looking into the cavernous center where every conversation echos. It reminded me of a prison. It needs to be torn down and re-built.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Park, Sleep,& Fly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenlinOceanCity_Md
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with numerous friends, have utilized this hotel several times when flying out of Philadelphia. The Sheraton is easily accessible from RT. 95. It's location is perfect since it is adjacent to the airport. The rooms are spacious and clean. The service was outstanding. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating. The "Relish Burger Bistro" has a nice menu and the prices are reasonable. The "Atrium Lounge" is the perfect place to relax with a cocktail. The park and fly price is extremely reasonable, especially if you are a member of their Starwood Preferred Guest Program.(Join free.) The Airport Van(s) run approximately every 20 minutes, depending upon demand. We have used many other park and fly hotels, but have settled on the Sheraton Suites because of quality, price, and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoingGlobal79
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at the Philadelphia Airport there are not a lot of good options. Marriott is the best of the bunch among very average choices and ofter prohibitively expensive. When that is the case I choose either Sheraton Suites or Aloft depending on price with Sheraton being my preferred choice. Sheraton suites is certainly showing its age these days and could use an update. It is in the same part as the aloft and 4 points and all hotels share the same shuttle service. The hotel is a standard American Airport Hotel and cannot be recommended as a must stay but cannot be faulted either as it gets the job done. I look forward to when the hotel is refurbished but at $120 AAA rate there are much worse options.

Reviews.Title: “I went at the wrong time”
Reviews.Author: Kt-Alexis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice. My room was huge. I stayed the Thursday & Friday before NYE. The people at the front desk were very nice. The parking qwas $7 a day even tho that is low I felt it could be free since other hotels in that area are free. I didn't eat there. Now there was a religion convention when I was there and they were so so loud I mean 2 am they are still loud as crap. It was alot of them and I was caught off guard the 1st night with the noise. I noticed it was people of all ages but come on take in your room.

Reviews.Title: “pick another property....... get some sleep!”
Reviews.Author: dfwbob
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst stay I have ever had at ANY hotel in recent years! I will start with check in where I waited 30/40 minutes to check in while people kept going around the line to speak with employees at the front desk and were not advised they had to wait in line like everyone else. Even though there was a SPG Gold / Platinum desk check in it was not recognized. The hotel this first evening consisted of large groups of children running the hallways till the very late night / early morning. Calls to the guest services went unattended and parents were nowhere to be seen. Going to the front desk resulted in no response either.Told they would talk to the groups but nothing happened. As the hotel is a large atrium sound reverberates throughout the building. Well night one done.... not much sleep. Asked to be contacted by the manager and not followed up by the property. Night number two actually got worse. ...â€¦â€¦ It was New Year's Eve and it seams the hotel had allowed "large" groups to occupy their rooms ( some with more that 20 by our count), large amounts of alcohol being carried in by guests and screaming and yelling from the balcony of the atrium till well past 3am in the morning. At some point furniture was thrown from the 7th floor to the atrium below, people screaming, fights breaking out and people passed out in the hallways. Calls to guest services went unanswered. At some point the police showed up when a huge fight in the atrium ensued and arrests were made? Needless to say a quiet night of sleep did not happen for a second night in a row. Requests to have the manager contact anyone from our group went unanswered and the lack of concern from the employees seamed to be "business as usual". The lobby and hallways looked like a war zone with trash strewn everywhere. Finally night three when we returned to the hotel from work and tried to eat a peaceful dinner in the restaurant. Drunken football fans two floors about the restaurant decided to yell from the balcony at hotel guests below and proceeded to drop their pants in a display of public nudity for all to witness at the restaurant below. When a couple with children sitting near us asked the manager to intervene and call the police nothing was done about it. They were insistent that the police be called but the hotel did not follow through and they left. We also complained and were told the guests would "quiet down" but needless to say not much was resolved. At what point do you ask guests to leave the property? What this all boils down to is a hotel which does not enforce it's own policies, could not care about the comfort and safety of it's guests and lacks any professionalism. As a SPG Platinum member I have experienced many great stays ( I spend 150 nights a year in hotels) but this certainly was not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpwoodfin
Reviews.Content: Like this hotel a lot. Very convenient to the airport. Rooms are comfortable and it's actually a two room suite so if one of your party wants to sleep and the other one work then you can. The hotel restaurant is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Always internet issues”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on quite a few occasions and it seems like there is always an issue with the internet. The staff doesn't always input your info so that you can log in once in the room in a very timely manner. (excess of an hour) The cable or wall jack doesn't always work. Once logged on the service is slow and inconsistent. I stay in hotels 3-4 days a week and it is rare to find a hotel that does not have free wireless internet anymore but this is one of the few that don't. I could adapt to the ethernet without a problem if it worked, but it usually doesn't reliably.

Reviews.Title: “wasn't expecting that...”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on 12/10/11 to 12/11/11 I was very pleased by the room. It was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I was also impressed by the building's layout. The Atrium was very nice. The restaraunt in the hotel (Relish) was absolutely wonderful. The food was pricey, however, the service was exceptional. The people at the front desk were very friendly,and accommodating. Late in the evening, there was a huge fight on my floor resulting in a tazing. Very much a surprise, given the prestige of the Sheraton name. Still, I am sure that was a rare occurrance. I would definitely reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: USFlyBoy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times this year and have always been pleased with the service and the rooms. Nice hotel with convenient shuttle service. Only two complaints: pillows are too soft and restaurant is too expensive. But there are several restaurants that will deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but we won't return”
Reviews.Author: WheretoNextNewYork
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our Thanksgiving weekend in Philly because it had a jacuzzi. Too bad it was being cleaned that day. And when we asked when it would be back up & running We were told "shortly" That was at 5pm -- at 8am the next day it was still under repair. Oh well. The shower leaked and the faucet was difficult to use. The bed was very comfortable. There are many choices in the area and we will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience..............”
Reviews.Author: 82-ag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 11/13/2011. It was a Priceline purchase, so the room was fairly inexpensive (maybe $95?) The good: room was fairly quiet, free airport shuttle, many TVs in lobby bar where we could watch several NFL games (they must have the Sunday Ticket). That's about all. The bad: room was very tired, carpet was dirty, finishes were rubbing off on the bathroom, drinks were expensive (not unexpected due to the fact it is an airport hotel). However, the biggest issue was the lack of customer service at the lobby bar/restaurant: I asked the bartender about pizza delivery, he recommended some local place, I ordered the pizza for delivery, my wife orders from the restaurant menu, we have 2-3 drinks from the bar, and when my pizza comes, the restaurant/bar manager has the nerve to tell me I cannot eat the pizza in the bar area! Now, I understand they have a restaurant to operate, but we were spending $$ at their bar, plus one of us ordered from their menu, and they knew I was having a pizza delivered from a local outside-the-hotel estalishment, yet failed to say anything until the pizza arrived. Poor customer focus! Just know what to expect if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Going down hill fast!”
Reviews.Author: travelenfool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night before flying out of Philadelphia Airport. We have used this hotel several times in the past and have never had a problem. We park our car there and take the shuttle, which runs 24 hours. The rooms are in need of updating, the furniture is worn and stained. The beds are still very comfortable. We found the hotel to be deteriorated since our last visit. The staff are still very friendly and helpful. The shuttle is extremely slow!!! They stated that it runs every 20 minutes, we waited at the airport for pick up at least 45 minutes for the shuttle. Several different hotel shuttles drove by us 3 or 4 times. Make sure you get a price that includes parking, if not it is an additional $7.00 per day! We are probably not going to use this hotel chain again because of the quality of the rooms and shuttle service compared to the price paid!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but...”
Reviews.Author: trvlnman101
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and in good shape with all the amenities but be prepared to get nickel and dimed to death. Parking fee is $7, internet (hard wire, no wireless at this property) is $10.65 a day and a $14 cheesburger brought to your room ends up costing over $21 !!! $21 for a cheesburger?? This place needs to get over itself!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Hart1092
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 517. There were several large stains on the chair. All the walls had marks and were dirty. Most of the lights did not work with the wall switches and the coffe maker didn't work. The grin desk is not friendly or helpful for any information as to places to eat near the hotel. It seems they work hard to make you stay and eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: It is a pleasure staying in Philadelphi. The staff made my stay there a second home. The staff in the restaurant made my days there wiz by. The front desk either knew the answers to a local question or got an answer and saw that I had got it. Each and every one of the staff members are a credit to themselves as well as to the corporation. The dedication and professionalism displayed by each of these staff members will always make them an asset to Starwood and the Sheraton Philadelphia Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place we've stayed”
Reviews.Author: dmarinaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the night before leaving for Jamaica, what a mistake. At 4pm on check-in we were told only the bar was open, a very rude (and intoxicated?) bartender not only took an hour to get us beers and our burgers but the order was completely wrong and food was disgusting. After finding out the only way into Philly was taking the shuttle to the airport and airport to down town we decided to stay in. Which unfortunately meant that we were stuck at the hotel restaurant again. Service was still poor, and food was cold. We got two bills for different amounts for dinner, hopefully not another scam by the staff. Overall the food was expensive, cold, small portions, and lacked any sort of flavor. The hotel was swarming with children who kept us up all night, even after we called the front desk. The rooms air conditioning was very loud and rattled throughout the night. The showers were tremendously loud, and could even hear our neighbors running most of the evening. When trying to confirm our flight online, we found out there was no wifi in the rooms, and half the computers at the internet center did not work. The rooms are large, but odd layout, two bedrooms- one of which appearing to be in what used to be a living room setup. The only benefit was that their hotel shuttle runs every 20 minutes, 24 hours a day. I would never never never stay at this hotel again or even recommend it to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the Phili Airport”
Reviews.Author: LMohrSugarLand
Reviews.Content: Upsides of the hotel are great food, friendly staff, great meeting spaces, clean and comfortable rooms, and convenient computer area that is comfortable. Downsides are $7 parking, which I understand is not bad for Phili, and completely unforgivable meeting room contracts. There was no other meeting there one of the days we had our meeting, and we were very locked into holding the meeting no matter what with no price break for using a smaller room than originally booked. Be careful with their meeting contracts. Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay, the food, and the convenience to the airport. It's only a 15 minute drive to get to downtown Philadelphia where I walked around quite a bit to see the historical sites. The cool thing about Phili is, you can just stop at a corner to check where you are and look up and you are at the house Jefferson wrote the Declaration of Independence at....or some other equally cool place. There is so much history mixed into the everyday hustle and bustle of the city. And these people know how to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ew, gross!”
Reviews.Author: aaronerdmann
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good: The staff was wonderful and the hotel appears to have been renovated in the last 5 years. The atrium has a great bar and business center with new computers. The room rivals Embassy Suites in size and quality of furniture. The livingroom is very spacious. I wish I could write a good review on this hotel, I really do. But there were stains EVERYWHERE and the wallpaper was peeling off the wall. The decor looked newer and the atmosphere in and out of the room was good as expected of a Sheraton. But it appears as if a rock band had a crazy night of vomitting in our room. On the second day of our stay we arrived back at the hotel at 10pm to find that housekeeping never showed up. I ignored the other reviews citing dirty rooms because the hotel was a steal at $95 vs $150's for all the other airport hotels. Looking back, I should have forked the extra dough for the Hilton or Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeplace”
Reviews.Author: Donz12
Reviews.Content: The hotel made our vacation. Having the extra room with three kids allowed us to enjoy our time while the kids were asleep. Very friendly staff as wel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DazzlinD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and I am always pleased with the stay. It is a very busy hotel but once in your room, you forget how much activity is going on in the hotel. We love the suite vs. just a room! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: PatheWest2
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly, and room roomy, but not up to basic cleanliness standards. Mildew on tiles in shower, dust clogging air intake of ventilation system, dusty air conditioner, stained dust ruffle on bed. Staff member on walkie talkie outside my room at 4:20 am. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel; I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: burnthiscity
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the not-so good reviews on here but I liked it! Checking in was a breeze and the guy at the check-in desk was very nice (cracking some jokes too). I love the set-up of the hotel - it's a square with the bar and restaurant in the middle at the bottom, with all four sides of the hotel looking down to the middle. We were happy with our room too; it was clean and spacious (loved the little living room area!) and the bed was super comfy. The only complain I had was that the hotel food is expensive and there isn't much nearby, but it's a good stop if you are going to the airport or are at the hotel for a conference, which we were. Also, we stayed over Saturday night when Hurricane Irene arrived to Philadelphia, and I felt much safer there than I would have at home! Another bummer was that the indoor pool was closed early for "emergency repairs" but I think it was just closed because of the hurricane, which was OK with us because I guess we shouldn't be in the pool when we have tornado warnings anyway! Overall a pretty nice hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for city, sports, airport”
Reviews.Author: JJnCJ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton Suites numerous times. Being from Philly and now living in Maryland, we tend to stay here more than any other place when we visit. We like the space the rooms offer although it's just the 2 of us. Sleeping in a room away from the hallway allows us a very good nights sleep. I guess the only real down side is they do charge to park and breakfast is not complementary like the Embassy just around the corner. And on one occasion, there were a lot of kids at the hotel who seemed to be unsupervised, especially late at night roaming the floors. That's when it pays to be in a place that is a suite and have a back bedroom away from the hall. When visiting friends and family, we like to get out for quick expressway access or when heading home, I95 is seconds away. I'm sure it could be a lot better but with a comfortable bed for a few nights stay, it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: rlinsk
Reviews.Content: Our family wound up here out of desperation after our flight home from PHL to MSP (the last of the night by the airline) was canceled. For $189 -- actually $217.73 after taxes and fees -- we wound up with a clean, comfortable room with two double beds. We liked the beds. We appreciated the in-person assistance of the front desk managers with various items including advice about the morning shuttle to the airport. Our teens enjoyed the pool. On the down side: * the AC unit in the room was very loud and kept us up through much of the night; * there was a shortage of AC outlets in the room; * we were unable to access either the wi-fi network or the Internet via Ethernet cable from the room (and were told no wi-fi was available on the second floor); * the hotel closed at 10 pm and was good but overpriced (see Yelp and other forums for Relish Burger Bistro); * the shower was difficult to figure out; * the front desk did not answer the phone when we called for wake-up calls and other items around 11 p.m.; * it took about 30 minutes to fulfill a request for additional towels. Good overall but could improve in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back...”
Reviews.Author: cher843
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a college tour of Pennsylvannia schools. Will not be back. This property has potential, but the area is terrible -- hardly any restaurants, shopping etc. an the hotel is very run down and dirty. The room was comfortable for a family of 5 but did not have a clean, well kept feel. If we ever come back we will be doing more research.

Reviews.Title: “Why the low ratings -- it was a solid 4 out of 5”
Reviews.Author: ldevitz
Reviews.Content: For some reason, this hotel has gotten bad write ups from Trip Advisor; good from Hot Wire. But then maybe lower rating were from people who haven't been here recently as they are showing signs of renovations going on. Very friendly, people pleasing staff as I always ask lots of questions. Our romm was VERY nice with lots of large feather pillows, two flat screen TVs and nice appointments in the sitting area along with a nice fitness center. Lobby has been upgraded also. Internet was complimentary in the lobby but signal was strong enough to get through wireless on my computer. Only negative comment was food options but then there were several delivery options (cheap) or other local hotels (more expensive). For the $, I certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and Rowdy”
Reviews.Author: nina93013
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here. We remembered it as an average airport hotel, but wow has it ever gone downhill. The common areas were the filthiest I have ever seen in an American hotel and I have seen a lot. Dozens of used dirty cups and empty bottlescovered the floor of the second floor lounge and hallway. So much crumbs ground into the hall floors that they literally crunched with every step. The pool was murky with gobs of hair floating in it. At night children and adults were running and screaming in the halls into the wee hours. Some guys were smoking pot in an elevator. While the hotel cannot control the quality of the clientele it attracts, it needs to have adequate cleaning and security to deal with the problems. Now they clearly do not. As we checked out a man was complaining about the filthy conditions and the woman at the desk said "the cleaners don't get here until 10 and it takes them a while." She didn't seem to care at all.

Reviews.Title: “Only okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: theresaw
Reviews.Content: Was in Philly on business and could not find a hotel anywhere. Was booked into the Sheraton Four Points, and after changing rooms twice due to filth and feeling unsafe, demanded that they move me elsewhere. Only availability was next door at the Sheraton Suites, so I fled. I always thought Sheratons were really nice, quickly found out that this one was only okay and fairly pricey for its condition. Old and outdated, the biggest positive is the big room and central bar. Don't expect a 5 star and negotiate a cheaper price and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKED!”
Reviews.Author: meballs
Reviews.Content: I was SHOCKED at how much I enjoyed my stay after reading many of the terrible reviews here. Chose this hotel based on proximity to Sesame Place and the city and couldn't have been happier with the cleanliness, service and convenience. Stayed with my wife and 3 kids who all had a blast. Didn't see any "sketchy" or "seedy" characters hanging around. Parking was free and convenient. The sheets and bathroom were spotless and the suite setup allowed the kids to go to sleep while we stayed up to watch TV. Easy trip from the hotel to Sesame Place on Saturday morning. No traffic. The free internet and printer in the business center made it easy to print out coupons for attractions we didn't plan for in advance. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: ekhtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is not a 3 1/2 star in terms of the rooms cleanliness and condition. They are dirty, terribly in need of update/repair and just overall yucky. If you use the fitness room- be prepared to inhale the scent of chlorine- it was overpowering and very disturbing. I won't be staying here again if I can avoid it.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before flight out of PHL. Check in went smoothly without any incident. We arrived late and there were very few people in the hotel lobby at all. The hotel is atrium style and it really has a nice look and feel to it when you enter. The room was very nice and spacious - definitely felt like a Starwood property. Since we only stayed for an overnight (late arrival/early departure) we didn't get to use the pool or eat at the restaurant. Used the airport shuttle which was timely and convenient. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel needs some work to catch up to the price.”
Reviews.Author: good2go4it
Reviews.Content: Checked in about 11pm. No restaurant or bar open. No wireless in rooms, you need to go to lobby. Electrical outlets in bathroom did not work. Now for the big problem, smoke coming thru ventilation system. It's a non-smoking hotel. Nice size rooms, comfy beds. Just a few things that travelers have come to expect for 165.49. A lot of money for no sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay86
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, I have to say I was a little worried about staying at this hotel. Never been to Philadelphia, I wasn't sure what to expect. Upon arrival and check-in, there was a bit of a mix up on our reservations (on our end I believe) but the front staff cheerfully changed the reservation with no issues. The large 2 room style suite was great...the front room had a large desk area with lots of space for working and the bedroom was nicely situated in the back of the room away from the atrium. I was working weird hours during this visit and stayed in my room during the morning through afternoon and was pleasantly surprised by the quietness of the room. We did not encounter any of the strange party atmosphere while we were there but we did only stay M-F. I appreciated the atruim with the common areas allowing for drinks, a bite to eat and a place to work and converse. I believe it's called 'Links'. We used the shuttle service a lot during the trip and were very happy with the service and the speed and friendliness of the drives. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was far better than I expected. Rating is 3.5 but should be 4.5”
Reviews.Author: jackluci
Reviews.Content: It is very rare to find a 3.5 star rated hotel that more than meets the criteria. The hotel surpasses the rating and I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There”
Reviews.Author: Fiona08
Reviews.Content: What a shame about this hotel. On first glance it has so much going for it. BUT Housekeeping: Room was not cleaned effectively. Trash from our trash can was seen on the floor of the hall. Someone put a bag of garbage outside their room that wasn't picked up for over 24 hours. Smashed crackers on the floor in front of the elevator not cleaned for over 24 hours. Significant hunks of dust on the door of the climate control system. Food Service: Very high prices and extraoidenarily poor service for breakfast. $7.00 for a bowl of cereal, $2.00 for a bananna. 45 minutes to deliver this to our table. Parking: Their park and pay system is not functional. At times we were in a line of 10 people trying to get out of the parking lot. Ongoing problems with the automatic ticket system. Overall: Check out was delayed by a line of people complaining about one thing or another. Don't go there. Location: There is no public transportation from the hotel other than returning to the airport, then using the underground. Recommend a shuttle to a train station in the direction of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Rest Assured, Nice place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: Kingster77
Reviews.Content: I must admit, after reading the reviews regarding the Sheraton Suites Philadelphia Airport, I was worried. HOWEVER, being a loyal SPG member, I decided to not be intimidated by the reviews and make my own determination on the quality. My son and I were very happy we did. This is a nice hotel; no issues with the parking, railing, rooms, nor noise. This is a great place...and the breakfast was very good too! Didn't eat dinner as the front desk recommended a place for a Philly Cheesesteak sandwich. Jims on south street (?) ...it was really good. Rest assured...you'll not have any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers1960
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 3 AM, weary and tired after a delayed flight from San Juan. The front desk staff could not have been more rude and unfriendly - there was actually a line of guests, but only one clerk working, the other one standing around doing nothing. The room was very nice, the beds very comfortable - no complaints here. But we still found it difficult to get to sleep because of a horde of teenagers (really - not nice kids; gangsta style with gold chains etc.) who were roaming the hallways, shouting, cursing and even fighting - all night long. This is an atrium-style hotel, so whatever was happening in the lobby (including a loud fight laced with "f...ing b..ch" and other niceties) was clearly audible in the room. The front desk staff did absolutely nothing. While waiting for the shuttle the next morning we had opportunity to observe all sort of strange characters walking in and out of the hotel - more what you would expect in a seedy motel on the outskirts of town. Who knows what's really going on in this place - it was a scary experience. Stay away, especially if you have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice at PHL”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites, Philadelphia airport is a very nice, atrium-style hotel and you will like it. Large, two bedroom rooms, two flat screen TVS, lots of pillows, above average bathroom, nice amenities, and a friendly front desk staff. My room faced the freeway, but the sound proofing kept it quiet. Included free coffee maker (Starbucks) and newspaper (in the lobby). There is a charge for the in-room Internet, but you can get 3 hours free in the lobby; my 3rd floor room could pick-up the lobby wireless . There is a $7/night car parking charge. The airport pick up was a little slow, so you might call when you land; the shuttle is the same for Sheraton, Aloft, and 4-points. I recommend this hotel as one of the best, especially if you get a good rate Separately, rental cars in Philadelphia are extremely expensive. You can rent from Enterprise at the auto-mall center (not the same place the airport shuttle will take you) for 1/3 the airport price. Enterprise can pick you up at the hotel, or you can walk from the Sheraton in 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Great for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: julezpower
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights at this hotel this week, and I couldn't find anything wrong with it. My room was perfectly clean and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade housekeeping, maintenance, and food service and I would be back.”
Reviews.Author: cruisejp
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Sheraton Suites Philadelphia Airport and was greeted by a very nice lady. Every employee of this hotel could not have been nicer! I was given my two rooms 831 and 833. I first entered room 833 to find the heating unit cover was off and that the unit was making much noise. I also noticed the heating unit was filthy. It had not been cleaned for a very long time. I was moved to 830 and this room had the same problem. The heating unit cover was off and it was making a very loud noise. Finally, I was given room 828 which had the heating unit intact. Once, I started to look around room 828 I noticed that the carpet was dirty. There were corn chips and straight pins on the floor. You could also see the dirt coming from the sides of the heating unit. I just gave up and kept the room. I also had room 831 which had no problem with the heating unit except you could see the dirt coming out on the sides. However, this roomâ€™s carpet had not been vacuumed and the bathroom had major mildew in the tub and air vent and hair on the floor which had not been cleaned. This hotel has a serious housekeeping problem as in two of the rooms the clocks were unplugged and not working. It was clear that the carpets were not vacuumed, bathrooms not checked, and the heating units were taken apart. I would think the rooms would be checked by housekeeping before they are flipped back into service. This was not the case. I had lunch in the lounge as the restaurant was not open. I sat in a chair that was so dirty. It had crumbs all over. I ordered Chicken Soup and Wings. I was presented the food without silverware or napkins. The soup was very good but the wings were over fried and served with an ice cold Buffalo Sauce. Not a great experience. I was given a free breakfast for the problems I encountered. Funny, I hold top level in three hotel chains as I live on the road. The other two chains give breakfast to their most loyal guests every morning. Not Starwood. I will not return to this hotel again. However, if you are a SPG member you might want to consider the Aloft next door.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING! !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kdd75
Reviews.Content: House keeping needs to be fired! Hotel is dirty dirty dirty! We unfolded sleeper sofa for our kids to sleep on,and there were dirty sheets on it. We had to call down twice before someone came up and when they did, they just handed US a stack of sheets and walked away! So now WE have to strip the dirty bed and make it ourselves???? I DON'T THINK SO! Again, we called down to the desk and no one ever came up, so my husband had to walk down to the desk. We were told they don't have housekeeping at night. By the looks of things, they don't have housekeeping AT ALL! There were even dirty dishes sitting outside our room when we got there. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not expecting additional guests”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJMS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the Philadelphia Marathon weekend (my first one I may add), and during my first night's stay, we encountered a visit from one of Mickey Mouse's relatives. YES, we had a visit from a MOUSE in our room!!!!! Our room was on the 2nd floor, and the hotel only offered to move us to another room on another floor, but that would not have made me feel any better. Luckily my husand was able to scare the mouse out into the hallway, but I'm pretty sure it made it's way into someone else's room. I really wanted to leave, but because it was the marathon weekend, all hotels in the area were full and I was totally exhausted from my trip to Philly from NC, and the marathon was the next morning. The hotel didn't even offer a discount on the stay or anything. My experience with this hotel was terrible, and I will never stay there again. I am also not one to complain, but I had to voice my concern. This was my first visit to Philadelphia, and with this being an exciting time running my very first marathon, I wanted this to be an amazing experience, and the hotel stay was awful.

Reviews.Title: “a strange mixture of good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Dutch Brother
Reviews.Content: It is hard to figure out what rating to give this hotel. We had a very mixed experience. First of all, this hotel is one of the most difficult to find in the US. While it is right next to I-95 and the airport, there are no direct exits or service roads to get you to the hotel. Twice we drove several miles out of our way to find the hotel. You use different exits from north and south of the airport. The hotel website should warn you about this. If you are not an excellent navigator, get great directions. When we arrived at check-in time we were told that a large group had checked out late and there were no rooms. They were just starting to clean the rooms at 3pm. We were offered a room where some of us would have had to sleep on a sleep sofa. We opted to wait for our room but after more than half an hour we decided to take a room that was ready. It was not the type of room we had reserved but at least we got to sleep on beds, not sofas. The beds were the best part of the room, very comfortable, so I am glad we held out for a room with beds for everyone. It also had a separate living room which gave our children more space to play. Another plus was a mini-fridge and a very strong showerhead. The main negatives were very worn furniture. The desks, tables, and so on had lots of scratches, a floor lamp was so broken the lamp leaned at a 20 degree angle from vertical, the heating unit door cover was broken off and laying on the floor. It looked like a dump. Another very disconcerting feature (for people with vertigo) is that all the rooms are accessed by hallways overlooking a eight story atrium. There is only a short rail (maybe three feet high) to prevent you from plunging to your death. Why hotels think this is attractive or acceptable for families with young children is beyond me. The hotel has an indoor pool and hot tub but we did not have time to use it because of the delay in checking in. The hotel also charges for internet and parking, features that a mid-price hotel near an airport should provide for free. While I appreciate the beds, not having our room when promised, the beat up furniture, the difficulty in even finding the hotel, having to pay for parking, and the dangerous design of the hotel mean that I doubt I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Bites”
Reviews.Author: CalifTraveler123
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, decided to spend the night in a hotel closer to the Airport, and didn't check reviews because at the time we didn't then know that Philadelphia was having this problem. We stayed one night in the middle of Sept 2010, and both of us got bed bug bites. I got them on my arms and calves, and my boyfriend got them on his arms and torso. Now I know how to check a bed for the signs, but how awful. 6 weeks and the bites are only half-faded. The management was kind and very sorry, and has promised to aggressively address the problem in that room and adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Property”
Reviews.Author: justjo30
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were super friendly and very helpful. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Great location for an airport hotel. Hotel will validate parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Psyren
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was greeted with superior customer service, the desk staff was very accommodating. The room was great, it had a separate living area, so we could put the kid to bed and we could still stay up and watch TV. The in house restaurant was nicely priced, open and the service was again, superior. The food was great, the pool was nice and clean. The room were spotless, fully stocked, and the beds were very comfortable. I can not say enough nice things about this hotel, or its staff. It was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for a hockey game”
Reviews.Author: corningcple5318
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a saturday night through hotwire and got a great deal. The rooms are really suites with a door in between the living and bedroom. Many suites are usually partitioned off but not here. The hotel was very clean, pool was quiet. fitnees center had new machines. The beds were super comfortable and the staff were really nice. No complaints here,,,, Oh parking is 7.00 and internet in rooms is not free.... But there is a mini fridge. We would definitely use this option again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable airport option”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property just outside the airport boundaries...only about 4 minutes by the shuttle which runs every 20 minutes to the terminals. The renovations in the hotel are very nice and it reflects an updated property, both in the lobby and in the room. The Sheraton Suites is a very good airport hotel if you're in town for a very short stay or for business. There is not much to do around the property, so if you are choosing this hotel to see Philadelphia, make sure you have a car and good directions. There was free wifi in the Sheraton Link area next to the restaurant, consistent with the Sheraton brand worldwide, finally the restaurant 'Relish' was decent enough for the evening bar food and breakfast that I had the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, lovely, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaHM
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in this hotel for a night because we missed a flight. Thanks to the airline, we could have a special discount so we ended paying around US$90 the night.... and it was totally worth it! They are 5 minutes away from the airport and a shuttle goes from/to the airport to the hotel every 20 minutes which we thought was great. We got a big room with two king beds.... ohhhh.... the beds!.... the beds were AMAZING!... they were not too firm, not too soft; the pillows were amazingly soft and confortable and the linens were all white and extremely clean and soft. I would defenitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Two completely different experiences - Will not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: StevefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of our vacation. During our first visit, we had a very good experience, with very friendly staff and a nice and sizable room. On our second visit, however, the experience could not have been more different. The front desk staff were surly, our room was in poor condition (Room 237 - faulty security lock, scratched wallpaper, and decrepit lamp) and there was no hair dryer (when my wife called for a replacement, they told her they were out of them and offered no apology). The hotel has very good proximity to the airport, but we won't be staying there again, even at Hotwire prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice outside the city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnsonNYC
Reviews.Content: Typical airport hotel. Nothing extravagant to write about. I noticed a lot of people just hanging out in the hallway outside of their room instead of inside their room. Housekeeping didn't seem too concerned with the upkeep of the room. I had to call to get cups when there should have been cups placed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Syvada1
Reviews.Content: On a very long flight schedule I missed my plane to Manchester, England so US Airways put me up at the Sheraton. I arrived late, around 10 p.m. along with other passengers who had missed our flight. The check in was quick. The restaurant was still open so I got to use my food voucher from the airline to eat. The food was expensive, the same as all hotel food, but good. I had a salad and it was one of the best I have eaten. The room was a beautifully decorated suite. The bed was very comfortable. I had to pay for the Internet in the room, but it did work. I had some problems with the lighting. The switches on the wall would not turn on and off the lamps and this was the only lighting in the suite, so I had to manually turn on and off the lamps. The room was a suite, and I felt it was such a waste to only have gotten to stay a few hours before checking out the next day. Check out was 11 and I went to the airport and waited 7 hours to catch my flight. I sure didn't want to miss it that day. The driver on the shuttle was very friendly. I had a very nice stay at the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. I wouldn't even mind missing my flight again if I get to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kiesha_k21
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a real treat. The room was nice and clean and we loved the setup of the hotel room. The only thing we didn't like was the area, I would not suggest this hotel for those who would like to site see the city of Philadelphia. Although it was a very nice stay, I was surprised about the $50 extra charge for paying with our debit card. All in all I would definetly stay at another Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: CJRSaintCharles
Reviews.Content: clean, spacious room, close to stadium and Italian market. Had fridge/freezer in room, which came in very handy. Quiet in room, but there were a lot of loud people roaming the hotel the Saturday night we were there. Stay away from the hotel bar / restaurant, though; a glass of wine was $9 (!) and a draft beer was $5. Our party of four had two drinks each, ordered either burgers or salads, and our meal came to over $120. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “A quick romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while spending some quality time with a friend. Both her and I loved the hotel, very plush rooms at a decent price, I think every room is a one bedroom suite with nice sized living room area and it was only 140 a night for friday-sat nights. Very good burger joint in hotel as well. If you need someplace to stay near the airport or just nice hotel to get away for a day or two in the area check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for $”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a Coldplay Concert in Fall 2008. It was 5-10 min away from Airport. I got a good deal from Hotwire and paid around $70. What we got was a 1Br Suite with king bed, and a sleeper couch. It also had a fridge and vault. It was very spacious. We had to pay $14 for parking and Internet/Brekfast was expensive..but I wouldnt complain because of the price. I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, HORRIBLE Restaurant SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: tripthisbowie
Reviews.Content: I was in Philadelphia for the Penn Relays. The rooms are GREAT! The front room had: a double bed, chair with foot rest, flat screen tv, a very long desk, and separate containers for trash and recycleables (I love going green). The hall area had a small sink, coffee maker, a compact refrigerator and freezer, and a closet. The master bedroom had a King bed, flat screen tv, dresser, and chair with a foot rest. After waiting 40 MINUTES for someone to take our order, I became VERY UPSET and had to ask two other waitresses to take our order. Within an hour, we finally received our food - we had to ask FOUR waitresses in order for us to get our food. When it arrived, my FRESH berries were molded! I could not believe my eyes! I asked for the manager, but she had stepped away. The restaurant apologized for the poor service and food. We also asked for hot chocolate when we were first seated which we never received. The staff made up for the hot chocoate by making my daughter and a classmate fresh hot chocolate. They gave me a to-go container filled with fresh fruit without any berries. Believe it or not, the food is really good once you get it. I am shocked that such a fine hotel would allow such HORRIBLE service to take place. They offered to initially discount our breakfast, then they said they would be free. I quickly reminded them that our breakfast was included in our rate so they were already free. I will be sending this same review to Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the $$”
Reviews.Author: haylotx85
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal for this hotel by booking through hot wire. I would have been very disappointed had we paid the $ 139 many of the other sites charged including the hotels. But since we got a good deal I am satisfied with the hotel. This hotel was comfortable and has been updated with new furniture and decor. The room also had a living area with a pull out couch, small kitchen area with a sink and mini fridge, office area with large desk that would be great for people on business, and the bed (which was comfy) was in a separate room. The building itself is showing age though and that is my only complaint. By showing age I mean the carpet isn't in the best condition, old heavy doors, old cock and tile in bathrooms, but I did feel like the room was clean and we only stayed one night at this location to catch a flight in the morning. Overall if you can book this hotel for a good deal, like $50 less then what the hotel asks then you will be satisfied too!

Reviews.Title: “See past the room price, they charge you for everything”
Reviews.Author: nomadicmatt
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here on business. From the moment of check in service was awful. No one answering room service or the check in desk, but I could see they were hanging around chatting. Room cost was $120 a night, but I still had to pay $10 a day internet, $20 for a bowl of cereal for breakfast, and $13 to get anything on the TV but the basic 30 or so channels of cr*p they give you. There are much cleaner and friendlier places for your money where you don't feel so ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: m3z
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an excellent choice for our stay. One complaint is that the design of the hotel (atrium/round shape) causes loud noises to be amplified. Thankfully we stayed in a suite that was not on the main corridors, so noise was not an issue. We had a great time, the staff was friendly and helpful despite being swamped due to the crazy snow blizzard of Feb 5-6, 2010. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast (pancakes, parfait, and hash browns) were delicious.However the service at the hotel restaurant was poor. We had to ask twice before we got a waitress. The woman who was the hostess was just plain terrible and she didn't get a waitress to our table. I think they need to work on coordinating better. Despite the mix-up at the restaurant I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed, comfortable suite.”
Reviews.Author: Traverse_afar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this very spacious suite for two nights with my children. Loved the separate room suite with coffee/tea maker and fridge (granite countertops). It was a very nice room and we thoroughly enjoyed. The center of the hotel is open to all floors, so the noise can reach the living space part of the room (was on a low floor). Hotel was packed, and the noise was still a respectable din. Went to Hotwire and found a 3.5 star PHL hotel with lots of amenities and a suite was one of them. I saved over 50%!!! (Make sure they don't give you the room with the huge units outside; kind of noisy.) They even volunteered 50% parking (extended park). Parking was already less than all airport parking with discounts! (reg. 7$/day). Free airport shuttle. One issue: food. Not sure if restaurants near, but delivery saved they day! Order in and save a buck... or ten! Breakfast started at around $16. Nice accomodating staff. All suite hotel, had a great time...loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel... unless you need the shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: travelguy20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for one night before an early flight and were very surprised at how nice and large the rooms were- true suites with a separate living room from the bedroom- and a bathroom/kitchenette in between. The rooms looked to be newly remodeled and there were two flat screen TVs. The room was HUGE in terms of layout and space. With the bedroom being in the back of the suite, it was easy to close the bedroom door and avoid any extraneous outside noise. The bathroom was fine- not elaborately redone or anything, but fine for an airport hotel. The bed was VERY comfortable. The only issue we had was with the shuttle service. We stayed there the Saturday night after New Year's for an early Sunday morning flight which any traveler knows is one of the crazier and busier days of the year. The hotel did not have enough shuttles running and it created a very negative experience in which other guests were jockeying to beat out other guests to get on the next shuttle. Granted, obnoxious and rude tourists are not the fault of the hotel, but if they had been running sufficient shuttles on such a busy travel day, this could easily have been avoided. If you don't need the shuttle, this is a great airport hotel. If you do, allow PLENTY of time to get to the airport, especially since the Philly airport tends to take extra time anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!”
Reviews.Author: Docgats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and the room was not very clean. The sofa in the living room was full of cat hair and so was the carpet particularly in the bedroom. I am not sure if management was aware of this but because we were so tired, we did not even bother bringing it to their attention. There were two tissue racks and one of them had an empty roll. The bath tub was also not very clean, it showed signs of not being properly scrubbed and also had traces of hair in it. In addition, the shower curtain also had stains indicating that it had not been properly cleaned as well for quite a while. Finally, there was no microwave, a factor that I found ironic especially with the rooms being suites and we had to pay $7.00 for parking! However, there was one positive thing about the room, the linens were clean and fresh and the staff was professional and cordial. Overall, I did not enjoy my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at Sheraton Suites Philly Airport”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Me2
Reviews.Content: I would not pay rack rate for this hotel. PRICELINE PRICELINE PRICELINE. The signage for entrance (driveway) is a bit tricky. the hotel has ample parking for $6/night Our room was clean. No complaints. The check in was flawless - the staff was courteous, helpful and a bit talkative (but NICE!) . the hotel is perfect distance to airport & to I-95 I would stay here again but only if I used priceline for a deep discount.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Anwen
Reviews.Content: Got a really good rate for Halloween weekend. Suite was very comfortable, quiet and clean. A real bed was provided in the sitting room as we needed two separate sleeping areas. Our king sized bed was extremely comfortable. I asked for extra towels as we were four and they only provided two sets - my daughter had to phone and ask for more to be sent up. They had not cleaned the room until very late in the afternoon - when they again provided just two sets of towels. The food was awful, cold and expensive. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The parking wasn't extortionate - $6/day - but I would have thought it would be free for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, restaurant was appalling”
Reviews.Author: codyal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here despite bad reviews because everything else was sold out due to a convention. We were there for just one night for an event at the Wacovia Center. We actually did not have any major problems with the room, noise or cleanliness. We did notice trays of room service food stayed in the hallway for hours- it is not a big deal it just seemed strange that no one would remove them and it was kind of disgusting. The room was really big , tvs and bed were great. We arrived early and did get to check in early so no problems there. The man who checked us in was very polite and friendly but could not seem to answer basic questions about how the parking system there worked (kind of confusing) or directions. However our main motivation for writing this is the situation we experienced in the restaurant the next morning was appalling. First there appeared to be almost no one working there and there was no one manning a starbucks coffee stand that was sort of part of the restaurant. There were a handful of customers, all who looked angry and upset and no waitstaff. There was a tiny disgusting looking buffet (and we are not picky eaters). A really rude woman -(calling her a hostess would be stretch) appeared and complained that someone had messed up seating at the tables so we would "just have to wait". She was not in any type of uniform or nametag, wearing trashy street clothes and completely unprofessional. We were finally allowed to sit. A customer next to us finally got the attention of another employee who appeared to be the only other possible staff member. She asked if he wanted his check and he looked horrified and told her he had never received his breakfeast. The same rude woman who intially refused to seat us then came out of the kitchen area, fighting with another person, screaming obsenities and dragging a giant bag of trash acroos the floor almost hitting us with it. We eventually left and never saw a real waitress much less have hope one would come to our individual table. We had the luxury of the fact we had already checked out and thank god were not headed to the airport or in a rush. I can not imagine being a hungry, rushed or stressed out traveler there. There is nowhere in the area to walk or drive ,no stores or restaurants and there is no in-room microwave, so you are completely dependent upon the food and service at that restaurant. To add insult to injury, when we left we took the time to very politely let the front desk staff know how bad the situation in the restaurant was so maybe they could alert someone to it. One woman just gave us a real fake "sorry" and the other woman (who appeared to be a manager or in charge) walked away as we were talking. Bottom line there are a bunch of choices in the area for the same money or in some cases less- no reason to stay here unless you have no choice. If you are forced to stay here bring snacks, drinks, etc. We stayed last year in the nearby Embassy Suites for less money and it was a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “For the price this is disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fontaine
Reviews.Content: What I didn't like: 1. Bed is not triple sheeted - I hate touching the blanket that a naked person sat on hours ago. 2. Starbucks closed at 7:15 am 3. Room not made up at 4:30 pm - I had to call 4. Despite what was written in the reviews here, there was no transportation to the sports complex 5. Security gate to parking lot did not work on two different attempts 6. Indifferent staff (except for one housekeeping supervisor); blue jeans are the new restaurant uniform? 7. Bathroom needed attention 8. Asked for an extra towel - did not receive it 9. First room - lamp broken and hanging over - how did the housekeeping staff miss this? 10. Signage poor coming from 95 S I am a frequent traveler to Philly. There were no rooms available in town because of a convention. I would not return here unless I had no choice. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Luv2bgone
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Sheraton with 2 of my girlfriends on June 26. We were in town for a concert and didn't want to drive back to Jersey later that evening. I found a great rate at the Sheraton and we weren't disappointed. The rooms are very nice, had two beds (actually 1 bed as soon as you enter the room, and then a king bed in a bedroom). Beds were comfortable, and everything was nice and clean. The clerks at the desk even recommended restaurants in the area, which were excellent. Definitely recommend this hotel and we won't hesitate to use them again when we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: ranchero59
Reviews.Content: We used the park and fly pkg. for our trip to Punta Cana. The suite was filthy. REEKED of smoke. Prices at the restaurant were outrageous of course no other restaurants were close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but staff screwed up too many times”
Reviews.Author: pftravels
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 13-month-old, so before I made my reservation, I called to make sure the hotel had cribs - they said they did. I then included a request for a crib in my online reservation. A couple of days before we arrived, I called to make sure there would be a crib in the room - they said it would be taken care of. Upon check-in, we were told there should be a crib in the room, but if there wasn't to call down. There was NOT a crib in the room. So I called down and they said one would be sent right away. We went out for dinner and arrived back around 9pm with a very tired baby who was ready to go to sleep - and NO CRIB IN THE ROOM. I called AGAIN. After several phone calls, and apparently a trip by housekeeping to another hotel to get a crib, we finally got a crib around 10:30 pm, which is just unacceptable. Tamika, the guest services manager, came by and was very apologetic and gave us tickets for a free breakfast. All was forgiven. The in-room breakfast tag said it had to be hung outside by 1am. We hung it out at 11pm, requesting breakfast between 6:15-6:30am. At 6:40am, our breakfast had still not arrived and I called to make sure it was on its way. It was not. She said she just got the order, she didn't know why, but assured us breakfast would be free. But of course, it was already supposed to be free after the crib fiasco. At this point it was too late as we needed to leave for the airport. So we went without breakfast and boarded our flight tired and hungry, and with a tired, hungry, and very cranky baby. The hotel had one more opportunity to make things right. I left my cell phone in the room and they had to ship it back to me. They asked for a credit card # and I suggested that they might cover this expense given the problematic stay we'd had and given that our "free" breakfast never arrived. Nope, they charged me. I was initially impressed by the location and accomadations and am disappointed that the staff was so incompetent as we would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No water and no apology”
Reviews.Author: china4me
Reviews.Content: NO WATER and NO APOLOGY AVOID Patrick Sanchez, General Manager Sheraton Suites Philadelphia Airport 4101 B Island Avenue Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 19153 Dear Mr. Sanchez, I am writing to inform you of a recent less than desired experience at your property. Check-in was on 7/09/09 and check-out was on 7/10/09 (confirmation #544428231). Your property was selected due to its proximity to Philadelphia International Airport, the fact that it was a suite property, and because I had an early morning international departure. Upon waking up on the morning of 7/10/09 I was disappointed to discover that there was not enough water pressure to take a shower. However, by placing a drinking cup under the sink faucet I was able to accumulate enough water to wash my face and brush my teeth. Unfortunately, I was flying to China and would not have the opportunity to shower for an additional 24 hours. Your maintenance department was called and a technician did come up to the room to investigate. However, he had no idea why there was no water. At this point I had no choice, I had to leave for the airport or miss my flight. All I could do was look forward to arriving in a third world country where water is available in the hotel rooms. Although I understand that sometimes things donâ€™t always work out as planned, I had expected more from Sheraton. If Sheraton is interested in the opportunity to make things right, I would be willing to give Sheraton another chance. NO REPLY RECEIVED AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, enjoyable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mets2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the most modern and well-equipped I've ever stayed at! Very big. Rooms were fantastic and included a little "mini living room". Our room was rather hidden from the rest of the hotel which was nice.The only problem I had was the bathroom. There was something growing on the ceiling. (Probably moss), and a massive amount of dust collecting in the vent. Beds very comfy and the in hotel restaurant was the slowest service I've ever had! Food was good however. If your looking for a place to stay in Philly for 1 or even a week stay. This is the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport alternative”
Reviews.Author: christianj
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay here to do several meetings at the hotel. As a business traveler the hotel met most of my needs and I cannot understand all the negative reviews. The room was nicely decorated and had evidently been recently redone. I particularly like the colors of the redo (red & blue) because it wasn't your standard hotel color scheme(tan and flowery). The suites are large enough for a family if needed and the living area had a nice leather sofa and a comfortable chair along with a nice desk area. I did find the lighting in the living area to be a tad dark since the windown opened into the atrium area of the hotel. Gym was very small but nicely equiped. The two negative aspects of the hotel are: 1. Since it is close to the airport it is not located near any restaurants 2. The hotels dinning options are limited. The burger bistro has good burgers but I was hoping for something a little healthier during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: CyberPhox
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a night during the memorial day weekend in May 2009, the hotel is quite nice. The high-ceiling layout is cool but it turned out to be really bad for our sleeping. There were kids everywhere running around making a very loud noise and we could hear it clearly from our room (perhaps because the beds are located near the door). We complained to the manager and they offered us $20 certificate that can be used to purchase the breakfast buffet for two. Overall, it was nice, we were just unlucky to stay there at the wrong time, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but shuttle system still needs work!”
Reviews.Author: travelfan04
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites is a very nice hotel. Checkin was simple, room was clean. Loved the separate bedroom, it allowed me to get ready in the morning without waking my husband. Bathroom was clean and sitting area was comfortable. The food at Relish, the burger place was amazing. So good that we went back after our trip before driving home. Food at Relish was good, service was good, prices were high but the food was worth it. Now for the shuttle system. We were told like many others that the shuttles run every frequently and as long as we were outside few min early, we would be fine. Well, we came down 20 min early to find a long line standing out in the cold. Of course, we didnt get on. The next one got there and was almost full from it's stop at the previous hotel. We didnt get on that one. Had to wait again and almost missed our flight. The front desk does NOTHING to assist with the shuttle issue. They dont call anyone, or help you out in the least. On the way back, the shuttle was good but that is because it happened to be there when we walked outside and we were the last 2 to fit. Had we walked out there a few seconds later, we would have missed it. Others we spoke to waited up to an hour for the return shuttle. If they work out the shuttle kinks we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Shuttle service big problem”
Reviews.Author: mlch1229
Reviews.Content: My family booked the stay and fly package where you could leave your car for 7 days. We had a 7 am international flight out of philly. We were in the lobby for the 4:30 am shuttle. There were so many people we missed that one. There was no line or order, people pushed to get on - it was complete chaos. One flight attendant actually pushed my daughter out of the way stating "I have to get to work". They only had one shuttle working and after we missed the 5:30 shuttle we took a cab and almost missed our flight. The hotel is nice, clean and convienent, but not worth the aggrevation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPrncess
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms at Sheraton Suites very spacious and clean. The hotel is convenient to the airport and the sports venues. They have a shuttle service from the airport which was convenient as well. I'd recomment this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to Sheridan Suites at Phily Airpt”
Reviews.Author: TripsNonnie
Reviews.Content: While on my trip to Philadelphia for a friend's wedding, I stayed at the beautiful Sheridan Suites at the airport. I was impressed with the appearance and the service, and especially the great nights' sleep. seems I never get to sleep "all night" but both nights here I slept so peacefully, all night, I was so surprised to wake up and find it was morning, the beds are so sleep-inducing!!!!! I could hibernate here, but the food and drink are great and my suite was handsomely decorated and spacious. I liked the adult milkshakes at the burger bistro as well as the food. One day I walked the less-than-a-block to the sister Sheridan hotel and enjoyed great salmon for supper. The free airport shuttle is a great bonus. I took it back to the airport just to catch the train into downtown Philly and that was an EASY, convenient way to get downtown and cost-effective. I had friends staying at a downtown hotel and partying there before and after the wedding who convinced me to come stay at the upscale hotel a block from City Hall, it was very nice but I sure missed my Sheridan Suite as the great downtown hotel was not as spacious, the people in service not as helpful, the room merely a room, and the cleanliness made me appreciate what I had taken for granted at Sheridan Suites, the place is spic and span. I love Sheridan Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok but could be great!”
Reviews.Author: kym72
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite with two double beds and a queen size sofa bed for $99 plus tax through the hotel itself. This hotel has such potential to be great but there were too many little problems that added up along with being nickel and dime'd to death. When we booked the room we were told that we could not be guaranteed that exact room. The alternative was a king size bed with a queen size sofa bed. That was ok for us since we were a family of 4 but this would not have worked out had our third child traveled with us. We called to confirm that morning what room we were going to be given and were told the king bed/queen sofa. Imagine our surprise when we checked in to find the two double beds plus queen size sofa. I attempted to check in at the kiosk but it was unsuccessful in issuing me key cards. When I attempted to obtain the key cards the man at the desk was completely baffled as to how I was "already checked in" without the key cards. This took several minutes of explaining that the kiosk did not work. The hotel was lacking in terms of cleanliness. There was a huge crack in the tub, the bathroom wallpaper was peeling, there was spilled nail polish on the bathroom sink, the duvet covers were stained and the dust ruffles were not centered correctly and covered with dust. The uncentered dust ruffle doesn't sound like a big deal but it was so long on one side that I tripped over it as I walked into the room. A room service tray with leftovers sat outside of a room for at least 24 hrs and began to smell of old food. In regard to being nickel and dime'd, this is the first hotel that I have stayed at that has ever charged me for internet service and the USA Today paper left at my room door. Even the Red Roof Inn provides these services for free. The bottled water in our room was $5 a piece and parking was $6. The free iternet service in the atrium was painfully slow and each user was only given 60 min. With so many other hotels in the area, I would be more willing to try out one of their competitors than to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Beautiful Room But Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: Joeker277
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the airport because we had an early flight and wanted to make it easy on ourselves. We got a good rate through Travelocity and checked in the evening before our trip home. This is a beautiful hotel with a soaring atrium and a lobby bar and restaurant. Check-in was quick and cordial. Our room was oversized and beautifully appointed--very modern, bright colors, big flat-screen TV, really nice bathroom (however, no tub), Starbucks coffee service. The ceiling fixture that goes off in case of fire (smoke detector?) was hanging from its housing by a piece of masking tape. Two of the lamps in the room did not work. The high-tech TV had not been properly programmed so some of the features did not work. For instance, you could not access the hotel information--menus, check-out, etc. We called Guest Services and an engineer came up quickly and fixed one of the lamps. They told us the shuttle ran continuously, just to come downstairs and check in at the desk. (The desk clerk said that some of the drivers had called in that morning. Nobody apologized or offered any alternative.) When we came downstairs in the morning, we waited 25 minutes for a van. When it came, it was already loaded with people from another Sheraton nearby. Some of the people from our hotel had to stand in the van. Philadelphia International Airport is overcrowded and this was the Monday after Thanksgiving so we had no time to waste. The delay with the shuttle made our morning very stressful.

Reviews.Title: “Needs imporvement”
Reviews.Author: CalvaryMike
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Gold member and this is becoming very typical of the the Starwood hotels. The staff was okay (nothing special). The rooms were clean, but they have problems. The AC is LOUD and the bathrooms need some work. It looks like it was recently renovated, but if it was, it was poorly done. The bedroom door wouldn't close.
