The lamination on the bathroom counter looked like it was melting off. The wifi was so slooooooow! I couldn't get any work done. A couple of times I asked for restaurant recommendations from the staff and they seemed very uninformed. They sent us to a seafood restaurant where the location was horrible. My wife didn't even want to get out of the car. We wanted to stay an extra night and all they could offer me was the $180 rack rate. Their website was offering me $150 and the Embassy Suites was offering $140. I showed them the Embassy rate and asked if they could match them. They said 'no', but they could match their web rate. Wow, but not thanks. I'm so glad, they didn't match the Embassy rate. The Embassy Suites is so much better of a hotel in every way. Their rooms are beautiful and the staff is GREAT! No charge for parking either.

Reviews.Title: “We thought is was very nice”
Reviews.Author: mel790
Reviews.Content: I had seen some unfavorable reviews but tried this hotel anyway. We did find the AC a little noisy but you can shut the door and it wasn't that bad at all. The units aren't those older under the window things but are operated with a thermostat. However, there is something about paying $6.00/day to park at a hotel where I am already paying to stay at still goes against my grain. Even with that though, the place was nice and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Piescobar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and we had great service. There is a shuttle from the hotel that picks you and tkes you to the hotel. Also when I asked how I could get to Lincoln Financial Stadium they said that the shuttle could take me right there. The service from all staff was just great. The rooms are suites, with a living room space and a bedroom space. The rooms were clean. The hotel restaurant Relish had great burgers! I would defitnely stay here again. The only bad thing is that it is far awy from the city center so to go anywhere it is a $30 taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tzandbr
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Philadelphia with our two children (3 and 1 and a half) and chose to stay here even though it was a half hour drive from our main attraction (Sesame Place). It was well worth the drive. Even though there were "All Suite Hotels" closer, there is nothing like the Sheraton Suites. As all the recent reviews stated, the hotel looks great with their recent renovation. The lobby and bar are beautiful and modern looking. Very inviting. I loved the open atrium. Rooms are very nice and comfortable. Great Sheraton bed. Even the pullout sofa bed was very comfortable. As for the complaints about customer service, most of the people I encountered were very nice. There was one lady in the morning who seemed a little "cold", but it didn't affect me in any way. I also asked her for some pillows for the sofa bed as we did not get any, and they were never delivered. However I never followed up and I am sure they would have gotten it for me had I asked again. There were a bunch of pillows on the regular bed so we just used the extra ones for our kids. There was a really nice lady by the starbucks. I asked her for a drink that they had never made there. She told me she didn't have the right materials for the drink and she would try to make it without it. She gave it to me for free and it was great. Overall it was a great stay and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise in Philly”
Reviews.Author: babydollprecious
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Suites in Philly in late July 08 for 5 days. It was awesome. I Loved it, Loved it, Loved it! The rooms were very spacious and beautifully decorated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. And I don't know if it was because I was enjoying myself so much or what but I never heard an airplane eventhough we were very close to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel and am looking forward to staying there again on my next trip to Philly. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and a great place to relax after busy activity filled days. I loved everything fom the pictures on the wall to the lamps in the lobby that created a calm peaceful environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Sheraton Suites”
Reviews.Author: slp2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Suites Philadelphia Airport for one night in mid August. We arrived and were pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel had been updated since our last stay about two years ago. Check in was very quick and we found our room easily. The room was also updated with new furniture and a nice neutral decor. All rooms have now been converted to non-smoking so you do not need to worry about the smell. We had no major issues with the room. I think we heard about two planes from the airport and few noises from the lobby atrium (although I think they have decreased the noise from our last stay). Bar/Restaurant: We has a few drinks at the bar and ate at the restaurant, Relish, the burger bistro. Drinks were good and reasonably priced. The burgers were good and they have a good selection. Parking: Lot is safe and parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated, Service Iffy”
Reviews.Author: traveler213
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one evening in June. Although late June in the northeast tends to be very hot and humid, this particular night was very temperate, so I cannot comment on the A/C unit. Check-In was relatively quick. I arrived about an hour early for check-in and was told my room was not ready. Upon reviewing my reservation, however, the check-in agent saw my SPG Platinum status and miraculously my room was ready. A bit tacky, but I suppose a nice service to loyal Starwood guests, although my feeling is that if a room is ready, allow the guest to check-in regardless of status...it's one less room to check-in during the evening rush. The room was beautifully renovated and very clean and comfortable. The layout of the hotel is atrium style. A room on the opposite side of the building from the elevator bank results in quite a walk...just something to consider. Late night food service is virtually non-existent and the hotel staff is not particularly helpfu, but I was able to find something at around midnight. the shuttle service is convenient and overall, I had a positive experience at this property. There is, though, a new aLoft opening next door in the fall (if not already) and I'll definitely give that a try next time I'm in PHL.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: jmhawk
Reviews.Content: Newly rennovated - beautiful rooms, lobby, dining area. We enjoyed our stay here - the room was perfect, seperate bedroom with King bed and living room with pull out sofabed. Staff was pleasant and always smiling. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families! But service is not great.”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Starwood Preferred Guests Cash and Points. It was a deal! The room is a true suite with a seperate bedroom with a king bed and a double pullout sofabed in the living room. Really nice everywhere and clearly recently renovated. Front desk was shocking. Not helpul and she was beyond disheveled. We asked about linens on the sofabed and she said we would have to check it out. They didn't look clean, so we called housekeeping and no response. Blankets were also a problem. Had we arrived earlier we might have sorted this out better. Our flight arrived at 10:30 p.m. and the hotel restaurants were closed. Front desk suggested vending machines which didn't work . One didn't work at all and the other ate change every other purchase. However, for families this is a great option. Nice rooms, great amenities, comfortable. We are loyal Starwood guests, and although problems, this is are really nice property that appears to be going through some staffing issues.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice, service horrible”
Reviews.Author: ab82Ab82
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was very nice. The rooms had a bedroom in a separate room which i loved. the furniture was great as well. however, the room did smell a bit like cigarrette even though non smoking. we stayed for the weekend and wanted to go into phili town to check out some of their night spots. we asked the reception lady on saturday night to get us transportation, because none of us wanted to drive. the lady was extremely rude and was not helpful at all!! we ended up taking a shuttle to the airport and getting a cab from there. What a mission for a cab!!!!!!!! it was ridiculous. the service is horrible, i wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: NefertitiLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! This hotel went from night to day. The lobby was beautiful. They installed this new high tech computer area. It ws suberb. The front desk ws sweet. One agent even booked my dinner reservations downtouwn and called me in my room to remind me when it was time to leave. The food was good. I recommend this hotel to all people. Especially buisenss travellers. The value is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Good remodeling job”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Sheraton Suites was favorable when I called the hotel and requested a shuttle from the airport. â€œWhat terminal are you in?â€� the operator asked. I hadnâ€™t a clue- I was standing outside the terminal inhaling exhaust gases and second-hand smoke. â€œI can help you with thatâ€�, she said. â€œWhat airline?â€� I told her, she told me I was in terminal C and the van arrived about 10 minutes later. I really did have a suite- a little dark since it was heavy on navy blue, but freshly remodeled, and very roomy. I immediately set up shop in the desk area and almost felt bad that my husband wasnâ€™t with me- this was an ideal setup for one person to work and another to lounge in the sleeping area, although the biggest plasma-screen TV was in the work area. The bathroom and a door are in between, allowing privacy and insulation from noise if needed. I liked the citrus-scented soap provided in the bathroom and the Starbucks coffee for the coffeemaker. Clearly this was an older property- there was a crack in the bathroom sink and there were stains on the white bathroom tiles. (Permanent stains- not a problem with inadequate cleaning.) But the remodelled areas made it feel fresh, and replacing every stained tile and imperfect sink would have just added to the room rate. One out of the 3 elevators was out of commission the whole 2 days I was there (Thursday/Friday) but the elevators were pretty prompt so it wasn't a problem. Pool on the smallish side but otherwise nice, with an outdoor view. Fitness center had 2 of each of the usual pieces of equipment. I was there for a meeting and the meals they catered were fine. Wi-Fi was reliable and user-friendly and available in meeting rooms as well as guest rooms. They could use an on-site gift/snack shop- there's nothing nearby and if you get the munchies your choices are the minibar, the restaurant or room service. I was perfectly happy with this hotel and would use it again if I needed to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Sheraton near the Philadelphia airport. After reading all of the prior reviews, I was a little nervous, but I am a Starwood fan so I made a booking. I was actually pleasantly surprised. The hotel is currently undergoing a pretty big renovation to the public areas, and they look like they will be very nice. The rooms are just fine - nice living area and bedroom, flat screen TV's, and from what I saw, the entire hotel looked pretty clean and well maintained. I was told the renovation will be done by mid-April, so be mindful of that. But overall, I would stay here again if I needed a decent place near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlandovisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel due to semanar being held. it is so old and in direpair. would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: travelnurseross
Reviews.Content: Rm 517, First the non-smoking room I checked into smelt of strong smoke & the carpet was filthy. The sofa had a few large stain & dried food on it.There was a bag with an empty water bottle under the sink. The suite was visibly run down!I went to the front desk & the receptionist was rude & ignorant. She looked up my information & told me, because I booked my suite through Expedia, they don't have to give me a non-smoking room, they can give whats available. Her tone was very unprofessional. She summond another staff member to check out the room and put me in room 611, which was also run down but did not smell like smoke.The only thing positve about this place is its closeness to the airport. There is construction going on so the outside of this place is the pits & One of the elevators was broke the whole time I stayed! Besides the view inside the hotel, It was like a cheesy motel! I am a Travel Nurse(RN) and this was my worst hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “terrible? that is an understatement.”
Reviews.Author: RIGuy1024
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin with this rundown and dirty hotel! I arrived at about 2:45 (check-in is at 3:00) on a Wednesday for a one-night stay and was informed they had no rooms currently available for check-in and it would be a little while. I noticed a handful of other people also waiting to check-in including some attending a conference in the hotel for Sunoco. So I wandered over to the "business" center which is two computers (one with a big sign reading out of order) and a printer. I decided to check-in for my following days flight and print my boarding pass except the printer wasn't printing anything, perfect! After about 20 minutes I wandered back to the front desk and there was now a healthy line of people waiting to check-in (it is now about 3:10). Finally they start checking people in albeit very slowly. I requested a room away from the highway and the staff member looked at me with a smirk and told me that was next to impossible considering how busy they were but my room was only partially facing the highway. I headed to my room on the 3rd floor and was disappointed the minute I stepped in. There were multiple holes in the walls that were simply spackeled with no paint and/or wallpaper. The carpet in the "living room" of the suite was also pretty dirty. There was a USA Today on top of the TV from the day before (Tuesday) which led me to believe one of two things: (a) my room was not cleaned or (b) my room sat empty all day Wednesday which didn't explain the "we have no rooms" comment. I parked my suitcase in the bedroom and stepped into the bathroom which was amazingly filthy. The grout throughout the bathroom was filthy and the ceiling paint was peeling. The "kitchen area" was a joke but serviceable. The bar/reception area is smack dab in the middle of the hotel and it gets LOUD in there when there's a group of people together. Thankfully, it wasn't while I was trying to sleep. Also, parking is $5. I got so many conflicting answers but by the end, I just drove out of the parking lot without being asked for my money. I can't believe this stay cost me $139/night. This stay wasn't worth $1.00 and I will never be returning to this hotel again. There is a Four Points Sheraton right next door to the hotel but even that has bad reviews. Starwood is building one of their new loft-style hotels on the same grounds, hopefully they spruce up the other two properties to match.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: H-Dad
Reviews.Content: This is the most terrible hotel I've ever stayed in. Dirty, run down,,bad front desk. Booked on Priceline and the 1st time ever disappointed in a priceline Hotel. It was in the highest category at the PHL airport. It should not receive more than 1/2 star. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice!”
Reviews.Author: derloc12
Reviews.Content: After checking out of another hotel in the area, me and my buisness colleague checked in here, although it was expensive ($209) a night (thank god for the expense account!) The hotel was very nice and clean, staff was exceptional and very helpfull, providing directions to shopping areas and attractions. The room was large and very comfortable. The gym was small but had very good cardio equipment all in all very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CharTrav
Reviews.Content: Just checked in last night for a week's stay. Read the reviews here a few hours before I checked in and was left worried about what I would encounter when I got there. None of my concerns materialized. Check in was quick. Got the king sized room I'd asked for (my spg status made a difference?). Would agree that the hotel is pretty old (the threshold to the bathroom is wood and hasn't been repainted in a while, furniture a little worn .. and dated .. but not terribly so, paneling in the elevators could use some re-finishing, etc) but...did NOT experience anything truly negative (no moldy smell, etc.). Bathroom is clean; towels are the usual Sheraton fluffy. Appreciate how the ethernet cable is long enough so that I can sit at the couch vice the desk with my laptop (internet access is NOT free but reimbursable for me). Room service was good particularly for a person who was VERY hungry (checked in after 9:30 with nothing to eat since lunch but a Twix bar). Bed is comfortable -- got a good night's sleep. Noise from nearby airport not intrusive. Can't speak to the noise from the elevator as I'm on the opposite side of the floor from it. Breakfast was good; staff in the restaurant very friendly and prompt (appreciate being given the check as soon as I got my breakfast so I could leave as soon as I was done eating). Based on my experience so far, I would certainly stay there again. My opinion may change by this Friday but I doubt it.

Reviews.Title: “Did Sheraton forget this place? Keep your shoes on!”
Reviews.Author: Latitude20
Reviews.Content: After waiting 45 minutes for the shuttle at midnight, the quickest check in ever, I still was grossed out by the dirty carpet, moldy tile in the bath and the fingerprint smudged coffee area. The morning shuttle driver was great and the beds were comfy. If I hadn't got half off through priceline I would have been very angry. The carpet was so dirty I wouldn't even walk on it in socks. I'd never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “What's up with Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: CammeronK
Reviews.Content: What's up with Sheraton lately ?. There was a time when the Sheraton product was as predictable as a Big Mac meal, you know what you were gonna get and in the majority of case left contentented. This certainly isn't the case at the Sheraton Suites, PHL Airport. Having specifically reserved a non smoking room with king size bed (and being an SPG member with a profile to match) I was a little frustrated to be given a smoking room. Back at the front desk it transpires they don't have any king size / non smoking available so I settle for a dbl /dbl no smoking. To describe the room's decor as 'tired' is being kind. The bed side lamp didn't work, nor did the light in the 2nd room. The furniture is cira 1970 and has numerous battle scars to prove it. The refridgerator is so noisy I attempt to unplug it but short of dismantling the room to find the socket decide to opt for the inflight ear plugs fortunately aquired from my inbound flight. I appreciate that airport hotels are all about short stays and a quick turn around of rooms, but does this mean that service and standards have to be compromised as a result ? Suffice to say I will be visiting this hotel again in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible at any price”
Reviews.Author: 70sbaby
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline and I was so happy to get a location somewhat close to the Wachovia center.The fact that it was a name brand Sheraton made the deal seem even better. I thought that I had gotten a great bargain at $70 for the one night that we were in town for a concert. As soon as I got into the room I knew that I was the one who had been had. The room reeked of mold. The ceiling paint in the bathroom was peeling and the bathtub was worn. I slept on the pull-out sofa, which had the worst mattress ever (and I don't expect much from a sofabed). As other reviewers said, noise travels up from the center courtyard, so we were awoken the next day by other travelers checking out for early flights. Another noise issue was the elevator, which had an alarm that went off loudly a few times. The redeeming characteristics of the place were free wireless internet and large suites.

Reviews.Title: “Look carefully.....terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: vokech
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend were at a wedding and had a suite reserved. We arrived at 1.30 am and checked into the room. As soon as we opened the door the smell of stale smoke hit. We asked about getting a different room but this was all that was available. We thought we could last a night. Then came the moment of truth. We opened the sofa bed and as often mentioned, the bed was worn out and not comfortable. The killer point was that the sheets had not been changed and there were still hairs on them!! Most of those with good reviews probably did not use the sofa bed. Check it next time and see if you're still happy....... On that note we left immediately and moved to another hotel despite it being 2.30 am........

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton should be ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: SCashCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend, using my SPG points - yay! free room! The hotel website showed a beautiful hotel - and it is from the outside. The hotel shuttle from the airport was quick. My family has a suite with 2 double beds and a sofa pull-out. There are apparently only 1 of those on each floor. We got room 225. We walked in, and were very disappointed. As a frequent business traveller, staying in Sheratons means clean, comfortable, safe room. This room was not of Sheraton quality at all. The room had a funny wet moldy smell to it. Being from the desert in California, with no humidity, I didn't know if that was from the climate or from a problem with the room/hotel. I know when I've travelled to the Carribean, it always smells funny to me. We left to find dinner, which is difficult with no transportation, unless you want to eat at the hotel. The hotel staff said the shuttle to the airport would take us to Ruby Tuesdays on the way, and they did. When we were finished, we jumped back on another shuttle that was dropping off some more guests there and returned to the hotel. Went back to our room, ready to relax for the evening, and that's when the "free" room started to not be worth it. We started noticing how gross and worn the room really was. I went to put the safety chain on the door - both parts of it were falling off. I took off my shoes - the carpet was sopping wet in front of the bar sink. The ceiling had stains on it from water leaks. The carpet was ripped. The sheets were limp and worn. We were tired, and decided to just make the best of it. However, there were 2 family reunions going on in the hotel. Right outside room 225 is a seating area for about 50 people for dining. The dining room was closed, but the people from the reunion were using it anyway, in addition to the conference rooms downstairs they had reserved. Also, the hotel has a large open area in the center, and all of the rooms surround this area. So people from the reunion were shouting to each other from floor to floor, across the atrium. I finally called and complained to the staff. They were very nice, and security did finally get rid of the people outside our door, after 3 calls. They also refunded my points for my stay. In the morning, when we went to shower, we found that the bathtub valve to change the water to the shower head was missing, and that the floor was really filthy, and the shower curtain was moldy. I'd had it. I called the front desk and asked them to book me two rooms at the Four Points, since we needed at least 3 beds and Four Points only has 2 per room. I didn't care the cost, I just had to get out of that room. They offered to try to move me to a similar suite if they could find one, or two adjoining King suites. I told them I didn't care where I was moved, as long as the rooms weren't as gross as this one was. They told us to go downstairs and enjoy a free breakfast while they tried to accomodate us. We noticed that laminated benches and planter boxes in the atrium and restaurant were heavily water damaged - at some point there must have been a heck of a huge leak in this place. When we were done with breakfast, they said they had two adjoining king suites (4 beds total) for us to look at. We went to look, and it was like night and day. Those suites were nice, clean, and didn't smell of mold. They were still very worn, but the staff told me the whole place was being renovated in November. We moved to those suites, and then set out to explore historic Philly. We took the airport shuttle back to the airport and then hopped on the train. That was very easy. Overall, this was one of the worst hotels I've ever been in. A Motel 6 is cleaner. However, the staff were all VERY nice, and VERY helpful. If you're going to stay here, wait until after November's renovations. And, of course, avoid room 225!

Reviews.Title: “No frills airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euroterp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Suites Philadelphia Airport recently for a business trip. Took the free hotel airport shuttle to the Sheraton complex, which also houses the Four Points. Security is in place with guards checking all cars coming into the complex. Surprisingly, it doesn't seem like a bad area since there is nothing around except for other hotels, the airport, and the interstate. There are no independent restaurants in the area and only pizza is available for deliver. I was disappointed, but ended up getting a $15 sandwich at the hotel restaurant. Consider picking up your food while at the airport. The room was dated with noticeable wear and tear on all the furniture. This wouldn't be my first choice for places to stay in Philadelphia, but it served its purpose for one nights lodging. Hotel staff made my stay enjoyable by delivering fresh baked cookies and bottled water. In addtion, the room had also had a free bottle of water. Little perks like this can make your stay worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “You have a reservation? Sorry, we're full (and you're screwed!)”
Reviews.Author: philly_traveller45
Reviews.Content: I paid in full in advance for a non-refundable reservation for a one night stay here after an all-day ordeal of delayed flights from Seattle. I informed the reservationist at the time that I made my reservation that I would be arriving after midnight and was told that this would not be a problem since I had this RESERVATION. Upon arriving just before 3:00 am (on Wednesday, July 11, 2007) I was informed that the hotel had been "sold out for the night" before 9:00 pm that evening. What is there about the concept or PRINCIPLE of a non-refundable, prepaid RESERVATION that the management of this hotel doesn't understand? What this means is that YOUR reservation is not really a reservation after all as far as they are concerned. Bear this in mind when you are coming to Philadelphia, especially if or when you are travelling there for business purposes!!!

Reviews.Title: “How high are your expectations?”
Reviews.Author: otterpreneur
Reviews.Content: Just passing through Philly, not going to leave the hotel? This one will do for a night. If you want to see historical Philly stay downtown. Trying to get back from downtown Philly was nearly impossible if you are driving. The hotel is a bit run down and in need of some updates. Our room was missing the microwave. But we got 2 nights through priceline for $75 a night and we did'nt really expect too much. There was a babycrib in the hallway and was still there when we left, plus other items left here and there. They are not real good on the upkeep of public areas.The rooms themselves were large and seemed to be clean. We left at 9 am for downtown Philly the maid was right next door cleaning. We returned at 3 pm and she was just starting our room. We had to wait in the hall. The staff was helpful and friendly. Pool, suanas, workout rooms and the bar were a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for an early flight.”
Reviews.Author: Travelvet1
Reviews.Content: One night Priceline booking (June 11-12) at $69. I'll keep this one short. Good location to catch an early flight. This hotel needs renovation. Our room was clean but very worn. On the other hand the bed was very comfortable. For the price we paid, I am pleased. I would not want to stay here more than one night. Staff was fine, but I only interacted at checkin/checkout and with the shuttle drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Maintained Property-A Disaster!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: While the lobby and public spaces appear clean and adequate, the rooms are a disaster. Stained and poorly maintained carpeting, thick dust on the black upholstery, dirty (soft cushioned) head board, with ripped canvas cover. I wish I would have heeded the reviews of this site. I have never stayed at a more unpleasant property. Were it not 2 am, I would have gone elsewhere. This should not be a Sheraton- it's more like a dumpy YMCA. I cannot stress how poor these rooms are. Avoid this place-there are many other options at the PHL Airport. Feel free to contact me if you are even remotely considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: mizprint
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at, this is NOT a 3 star hotel. Room furniture was Salvation Army throw outs, Blood stains on the carpets, housekeeping did not vacuum for 3 days! Missing light bulbs. Beware, this is NOT a good place to stay. I have photos, if anyone wants to contact me to see them

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: azroadrunner
Reviews.Content: We hadf a great stay at the Sheraton Suites for two nights. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We had several family members so we really liked the two room suite and the 2 tvs. Shuttle service from the airport is smooth and goes to both the Four Points and the S Suites. Checkin was friendly and quick. Several computers are available for guests to check mail and check in for flights. Parking is only $5 if you have a car. We got in late in the day so went to watch the Derby in the bar. The service, snacks (wings, bruschetta) and drinks were all terrific. Later that night we went next door to the Four Points for their special local beers and a philly cheesesteak. Great bartender- helpful and gracious. The indoor pool and big spa were popular. After 9, the pool area is only open to adults which made the spa more inviting after a busy day. I think this hotel is a great deal and nice location for accesss to the airport and city. The 24 hour shuttle is nice to catch those early flights out for vacation too.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Sheraton Standards...Stay at the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: VaNukeGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was disgusting, especially for a Sheraton. The only reason I'm rating it a 2 not 1 is the staff was exceptionally friendly. I flew to Philly this weekend to see a friend for the weekend who had booked us a room for Saturday at the Sheraton Suites. (I stayed the remainder of the week at the Hampton Inn on business.) The layout of the room seemed ideal since we wanted to share a room, but still have some privacy. The room was disgusting; here's why: 1. The bathroom MAY have been wiped down before we arrived, but it was certainly a while since it had seen a good cleaning. 2. There were dirty room service dishes outside of our room in the hall that were still there when we checked out. (obviously from some previous guests) 3. The wall paper was peeling off the wall where there was No baseboard! I was pretty turned off by that alone until I notced the 4. Random holes in the drywall around the mirror above the peeling wallpaper. (This gave the room that not-so-pleasant scumball motel feel.) 5. The paint was flaking off the cabinet by the wetbar. (Once again, Where am I... the Bates Motel?) 6. The carpet was gross. (I didn't take my socks off until I went to bed, then they went into their own plastic bag.) and for the grand finale... 7. When we pull the cushions off of the couch to pull out the sofa bed, there was a mystery white substance (yeah, it looked like THAT) all over the cushion that no one had ever even tried to clean. With the bad weather in Philadlphia this weekend there was no hope of getting another room, so we were stuck. Don't let this be you...

Reviews.Title: “Expected better from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Tumaini
Reviews.Content: I recently chose this hotel because I had an early flight out of Philadelphia International Airport. I must admit that I expected a hotel in the Sheraton chain to be much better. My first experience with the hotel was the poor parking. I ended up having to park quite far away in the back of the hotel. As a woman traveling alone I didn't feel safe walking to the hotel. The check-in process was fine and the young woman who checked me in was lovely and helpful. I went to my room only to find a space which was extremely musty smelling and with stains on everything. I went back down to the front desk and the same young woman allowed me to change rooms. The second room was not much better but the odor wasn't quite as strong and the stains on the bedding not as bad. I would not recommend this hotel unless no other options are available in the Philadelphia area.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: bb24aka
Reviews.Content: Pros-Location is pretty good. you can jump on 76 and in about 10 minutes you're in center city. The lobby is nice and the service was pretty good. Cons-The room was old looking with stains on the carpet and ceiling. My friend had a big stain on her bed comforter. We immediately called the front desk. They did not have a comforter to replace it. They said they would clean it and it would take about an hour. They never came back. The bathroom sink had a slow drain, so when you brushed your teeth you had gunky water floating in the sink for about 10 minutes. If you like nice hotels, or are a bit of a hotel snob, DON'T stay here. If you need to be near the airport, are on a budget, or aren't too particular about hotels, then it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites”
Reviews.Author: Vermont95
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Suite was large. Sofa, chair, TV and desk for business in first area, a hallway with refrigerator, bar sink and coffee maker, good sized bathroom and then a separate room with king bed, TV, chair, 2 night stands and plenty of lights. Exellent value. Good shower, great bed, lots of pillows. Gated parking lot. Was pretty quiet for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrzyshawn
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t understand what all the complaining is about. This is a Sheraton, Not the Ritz-Carlton. Expect to get a clean, comfortable room and a good price. I live in New Jersey and take weekend trips down to Philadelphia every few weekends. This hotel is an all suite hotel with very reasonable rates. The AAA rate is usually about $99 with free parking. The hotels downtown and well over $200 a night and parking is usually $25 a night. I have no problem with staying 15 minutes outside the city and saving $125 a night. The suite is a large 2 room suite with a very comfortable soft bed and great comforter. The furnishings are not super modern, but are ok. I never had a room with ripped or torn furniture. Again this is a Sheraton, not the Ritz-Carlton. The location is very close to down town, about 15 minute ride up I-95. I never head any highway or airport noise whatsoever in my room. The last time I stayed there the maid was cleaning the room next door and she stopped me before I headed out. She wanted to make sure I had everything I needed. She offered to leave me extra towels, extra bottles of water, or anything else I may have needed. I felt like they were very attentive. Upon check-out they had the wrong rate for me. I pointed out the mistake and provided them a copy of my confirmation and without hesitation they corrected the error and apologized for the trouble. I have stayed here about 4 times so far. This is much better that the Four Points Sheraton next door. Just pay the extra $10 a night and stay at the Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Opinions”
Reviews.Author: tylerarb
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I booked the Sheraton Suites with some apprehension, especially since all of the other hotels at the airport were full. Why did the Sheraton have a vacancy, I wondered? My experience, for $169, was OK, but just that. I expected more value for the price. On the plus side, the hotel is convenient, has more interesting architecture than most airport locations and, contrary to what some other reviewers experienced, my room was clean, the bed comfortable and the plumbing, electrical and HVAC worked as they should have. The room decor was acceptable, but spartan. Bare walls above the sofa bed (did not try it to see how it worked) and the matching chair gave a decidely unfinished feeling to the room. The furniture style was an early and not wholly successful imitation of "Pottery Barn", which I did not mind too much. First impression of the room was modestly favorable. It also was quiet, a big plus. However, with the lights on came reality. The furniture was in poor to bad condition: dents, scratches, gouges, stains and--in the bedroom--the bottom drawer of the combination TV armoire/dresser was bashed in. The bottom drawer simply was impossible to open. I was alone, did not need the space and was staying only overnight, so I did not report it to management. Breakfast the next morning was pricey, but really not unexpected and not much different from other hotels of this type. I certainly have paid a lot more in downtown hotels in various cities. For coffee, oatmeal, organge juice and toast, the bill came to $20, tip and tax included. Service was fine, but the nicely pressed tablecloth had what appeared to be coffee stains and the silverware was badly spotted, which I hoped was from the dishwasher and not a previous guest. I asked for and got replacements, which were in similar condition, so I ended up using a spare napkin to wipe off the spoon and knife.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for those early flights out”
Reviews.Author: o2bmmw
Reviews.Content: During the Valentine's Day ice storm, our flight to Florida was cancelled, but we were lucky enough to have a flight out very early the next day. Rather than drive on icy roads at 4 am with 2 kids, we opted to use some Starwood points and stay at this hotel. The good: I accidentally booked the wrong date and the hotel was booked up, but the manager got on the phone and was able to help us change the room to the night we needed. Front desk staff and bellman were very friendly and helpful when we checked in in the evening. The King bed was good. TV channels were good. The lobby and public areas are impressive. The dessert we bought for our daughter in the restaurant was good and service was prompt. Airport shuttle service was prompt and helpful, and parking costs were reasonable. The bad: We were sent to a room that obviously had not been cleaned since the last occupant left (bed was slept in, water glasses around etc). We called down and they changed our room. Pillows were sad and because the hotel was so booked, they were all out of additional pillows. The restaurant hostess does not appear to have ever cracked a smile in her life, despite our going overboard to be nice and complementary to her. We had a similar experience with our waitress. The ugly: The pull out sofa. REALLY! The mattress was so old and worn that the foam was coming out. This was patently unacceptable . Our kids were so tired they slept without a problem . HAd we been staying longer, I would have insisted on being moved again. Summary: Given what we paid (NOTHING) and the convenience of needing to be by the airport with parking on an icy night, we think it was worth it. We would stay there again if we had a super early flight out. But I agree that the rooms are tired and need updates. Public areas are fine though. If you aren't stuck at the airport, or if you don't have an early flight, I can't think of any reason to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A fine airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harlaching
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews. We scored two Thursday night rooms at $70 each via Priceline and were very happy with the entire experience. It's a big somewhat impersonal place, but what do you expect at an airport hotel? The rooms are very large suites giving you plenty of space to stretch out. The beds were very comfortable. There was absolutely no aircraft or road noise and the a/c also was very quiet which enabled us to get a good night's rest after a long transatlantic flight. We found the staff very nice and helpful. OK, the furnishings are bit worn but nothing unusual compared to what you would expect at a 3 star chain hotel. We spent $89 with tip and tax for a nice breakfast for 4 people, which we felt wasn't very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: bnnerb
Reviews.Content: I was stuck on a layover in PA. I was comped a room here and had only 5 hours to sleep before the next FIRST plane out back to Michigan from Boston. I could have and probably should have taken a later flight to stay longer at this hotel. The room was fabulous. Warm and cozy. Shower was very impressive, expensive with the rich taste. The bed was absoultely amazing, words cannot even describe the cozziness. It was perfect. I have since then never slept better. You sink right in the bed with the squishy matress and down blanket and pillows. If I could afford it- I would fly there just to sleep in that hotel again, That's how great my stay was. The archeticture was amazing. The staff was great. I got the luxury of staying there among all the overworked pilots and hostess' - So in conclusion: I repeat- Best Hotel I have ever stayed at- Best part was it was Free!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: weddingtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Suites has a lovely entrance as it is atrium style and it is impressive to look at. There is a little business center which is convenient. The room furniture is mostly upgraded but you can still tell that the room is old. The carpet and bathrooms were old. Also, if you have someone sleeping outside it can be noisy. But it's great for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: NotAnother
Reviews.Content: For $170.00 per night I expect a bit more than finding a very visible stain on the bedspread, lights hanging out of the fixtures by their wires, damaged cabinets and furniture, peeling wallpaper, fixture hanging holes in the bathroom where there used to be fixtures, a couch that is well on its way to being a sinkhole, and such thin walls I thought the person taking a shower next door was actually in my shower. There are lots of alternatives near the Airport that offer much better quality rooms for the same or less money.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standards”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSammy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not Sheraton quality. I checked in, went up to my room in a very dirty and taterd elevator and checked out 10 minutes later. The room was not clean or comfortable. The common areas (hallways, lobby, elevators) should have alerted me prior to check in as they are scuffed, dirty and poorly maintained. The Hilton next door is a much better choice. If you are not looking for quality, it may satisfy your needs. If you typically prefer a higher level of quality, service or accomodations, this hotel is not for you. 2 stars at best.
